caption.center: STATE OF MISSOURI, RESPONDENT, v. DARRELL BURNS, APPELLANT.

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

date.center: Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied July 12, 1985.

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM CIRCUIT COURT, CITY OF ST. LOUIS COUNTY; THOMAS C. MUMMERT, III, JUDGE.
opinion.attorneys:
Debra Buie Arnold, St. Louis, for appellant.
John Munson Morris, Asst. Atty. Gen., Jefferson City, for respondent.
opinion.opinion_text: [1] Defendant, Darrell Burns, was convicted, after a jury trial, of selling heroin. He appeals from the judgment of the trial court sentencing him, as a prior and persistent offender, to eighteen years' imprisonment, to run concurrently with sentences imposed in previous causes. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. The judgment of the trial court is affirmed pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).
